meanings.definition: Cause a sudden sharp pain or pang.
meanings.sent1: Bending over quickly can result in twingeing your back.
meanings.sent2: She winced, twingeing as she lifted the heavy box.
meanings.sent3: The cat twingeing its tail when it got caught in the door.
meanings.sent4: The memory of her lost pet twingeing her heart like a sharp arrow.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the alarm clock twingeing her awake every morning.

meanings.definition: Experience a sudden sharp pain or pang.
meanings.sent1: He felt a sudden twingeing in his knee as he climbed the stairs.
meanings.sent2: She twingeing in her side after running too fast.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected joke had everyone twingeing with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The old wound twingeing with the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread twingeing memories of childhood.
